Posts.Content: armadillo1 wrote: My CEA reading 6 months ago was 3.6 and now it is 4.6 My Dr. wants me to have a colonoscopy next week, now I am worried.  All the other tests were good.  Has anyone had changes in their CEA readings? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: CEA readings armadillo1 bevin

Posts.Content: Jan 21, 2011 12:36PM armadillo1 wrote: Does anybody have trouble with scar tissue?  Well I do and it really hurts when the weather get cold.  Sometimes I feel like I have a knife sticking in my scar area.  Have been going to P/T twice a week and she stretches and tries to break the scar tissue up....she says it will be a continuing issue.  Any input from anyone?  My LE is pretty much under control, just the discomfort of the scar tissue...
Posts.Title: LE/Fibrosis/Cording or Local Recurrence? marymoir armadillo1

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2010 11:20AM armadillo1 wrote: I had a bi-lateral with 14 nodes removed..no reconstruction.  However, I get terrible spasms on the left side where the nodes came out.  I notice that when the weather is cold I get more that enough spasms.  It feels like a knife is going thought my chest...then after a minute or so it goes away,  does anyone else have these spasma.  After 7 years I would think scar tissue and nerve endings would have settled down,
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Pain Syndrome (PMPS) Deeds Lezza13

Posts.Content: Jan 12, 2012 11:17AM armadillo1 wrote: I am 10 years from dx and was Stage IIb, had only sentinel node as positive with 14 nodes removed.  Had a bi-later mastectomy.  6 cat and 37 weeks of rads.  Now the CEA went up from 3.6 to 4.6 in 6 months.  Dr. wants me to have a colonoscopy, of course, how cannot I now worry?  I had my last colonoscopy 2.5 years ago with no polyps...so I am needless to say concerned.  Jan 18 I will have the procedure done and will go on from there.
Posts.Title: CEA level went from 1.3 to 2.4 - should I be worried? Godlistens Godlistens

Posts.Content: armadillo1 wrote: I had to have a chest x-ray for an upcoming surgery.  The tech asked me if I had any recent surgery on my arm/shoulder?  I asked and she said I had clips in my left shoulder in the area of where I had lymph nodes removed over 6.5 years ago.  All this time no one ever mentioned this and now I am wondering if this is the reason I have the feeling of something irratating in my arm pit area?  Has anyone ever had a x-ray tech tell them this and if so why would there be clips in that area?  It just seems odd that this is the first time I have been made aware of this.  My left arm is always hurting, I use the Circaid wrap, I get MLD at a clinic, and the  lymphademe is not too bad.  It just always feel like I have a piece of ragged wood in my arm, scar tissue I have been told.  Please share. Yes I am here, and I am grateful...but we all worry about those little things. Log in to post a reply
